A valve classic; a fantastic puzzle game with a great story and sense of humour. The community workshop support has also produced some real gems and extends the life of the game indefinitely. Co-op is fantastic too. Highly recommended, especially with a friend.

Honestly one of my favourite games in the world, i would none stop play this game and wont get bored of it. Definitely recommend it :))

Portal 2 is a prime example of how a video game sequel should be done. Everything from the first game is expanded and improved upon from the narrative, gameplay mechanics, and amount of content available. The narrative itself contains a very interesting plot-line as well as some of the funniest and most cleverly written dialogue I can remember in gaming. When it comes to the gameplay, Portal 2 feels extremely polished and unique alongside a stellar co-op mode.
finally..i fucking..I've finally cried with another game..i'm happy but sad..DAMN..i love this game <3

I called out the villain all along. I KNEW IT. 
Also the cake is a lie.

This was one of those games which I had heard a lot about but never played; it had co-op so I got it to play with a friend. Initially I only played the co-op which was really fun and gave a great sense of satisfaction once we figured out a challenging puzzle- since I enjoyed it so much I decided to try out the single player (I realise the co-op story is based after the single player story now). The world building in this game is phenomenal, every single character is wonderful and really add to the story, even the world building through easter eggs and the comic give this game and its story so much depth; the puzzles gradually get more complex and slowly introduce different mechanics while still maintaining the simple idea of only having two portals to work with- each puzzle presents its own unique challenge and they vary enough that they never become boring or tiresome. This game was a pleasure to play and it deserves every ounce of love from its community, I can't believe I waited this long to try it.

I was looking for a nice coop game to play with my girlfriend. Not something that requires you to shoot or kill. I heard about Portal in the past but never looked into it or knew what the game was about.  Bought the game for myself and gifted her a copy, and we're hooked! To solve puzzles together really takes teamwork, thinking and most of all... patience! This game does great in teambuilding!

very good single and multiplayer enjoyable

This is a masterminds correlation of pure tested game play. A testament to dedicated thought processes being seen to unparalleled satisfying fruition, beautifully tuned co op play, the physics of the puzzles is always interesting and thought  provoking and often funnier than a mandatory, [(:{ non-company-liable }:)], terminally dangerous testing chamber full of nitrous oxide and deadly deadly chemicals yeeee... (teeth squeek) good times! 
so with the exception of poor joy pad config (the cluncky old x-box pad works but the ps4 seems to be almost deliberately packed in like eggs at the bottom of the bag. ?) that apart I have a really tough time thinking of anything that isnt made from pure concentrated UUGGHHH!

The sound track.
I once had a troubled plater drive that could've passed for a cheap band member. it was so messed up that it clearly had developed a rebellious rhythm, left it in cause loved the funky tune it made when it booted, plus I knew that it was gifted but not well understood.
music made from the sounds of engineering and science, server concertos, mixes made from broken glass (plus other Aperture deductible machinery costs.) marginally unstable main frame solos, lament of A potato OS, Latin defence turret opera not to mention other mad science mixes to deconstruct by.

Voice over artists are sync with the comedy algorithm and voice actors cast perfectly. Its a very polished work of vocal phonic succinct concurrence that makes you laugh from unfamiliar places like your middle toes in a subterranean testing facility located at the core of Pluto shrunk to the size of a lactose intolerant cow, though this is probably included in the medical disclaimer!
..and please! do not be ashamed if during single player you get just the littlest bit of wee ..psst its ok your not incontinent its simply because your urethra is laughing!

P.S
